content.text:
Here is the memo for answering telephones and directing calls:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
To: All Staff
From: [Your Name], Senior Medical Secretary and Administrative Assistant
Subject: Answering Telephones and Directing Calls

As the Senior Medical Secretary and Administrative Assistant, one of my key responsibilities is to answer incoming telephone calls and direct them to the appropriate staff members. When answering calls, I will:

• Greet the caller in a friendly and professional manner
• Identify our medical practice and introduce myself
• Ask how I may assist the caller
• Listen carefully to the caller's request or inquiry
• Determine the appropriate staff member who can best assist the caller based on the nature of the call
• Transfer the call to the relevant staff member
• Take a message if the staff member is unavailable, and relay the message in a timely manner
• Handle basic inquiries myself if I am able to assist the caller directly

By promptly answering calls and directing them to the appropriate personnel, I will ensure our patients and other callers receive efficient and helpful service. Please let me know if you have any questions regarding our telephone procedures. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
